docs.abstract: Brighton has risen into the top half of the league with smart signings, contingency plans and a spreadsheet that sees the future.
docs.snippet: Brighton has risen into the top half of the league with smart signings, contingency plans and a spreadsheet that sees the future.
docs.lead_paragraph: BRIGHTON, England — The floor-to-ceiling windows in Paul Barber’s spartan office offer a panorama of the lush green practice fields of Brighton and Hove Albion, the Premier League soccer team he has run for the past 11 years. The secret to Brighton’s success, though, is for his eyes only.

headline.main: The Secret Behind the Premier League’s Smartest Team

docs.abstract: American officials and The Wall Street Journal have vehemently denied the accusation that Evan Gershkovich was engaged in any kind of spying activity.
docs.snippet: American officials and The Wall Street Journal have vehemently denied the accusation that Evan Gershkovich was engaged in any kind of spying activity.
docs.lead_paragraph: Russia’s ambassador to the United States said that Washington had threatened to retaliate if Moscow did not release the Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich, who was arrested in Russia and charged with espionage, marking a new low in tensions between the two countries.

headline.main: Russia’s ambassador says the U.S. threatened ‘retaliatory measures’ unless a jailed reporter is released.

docs.abstract: Courts don’t make laws. Congress does.
docs.snippet: Courts don’t make laws. Congress does.
docs.lead_paragraph: Will abortion be the issue that kills the filibuster?

docs.abstract: As M.L.B. celebrates Jackie Robinson Day, scholars from a foundation created in his honor — like Rep. Lauren Underwood — work to fulfill his vision for society.
docs.snippet: As M.L.B. celebrates Jackie Robinson Day, scholars from a foundation created in his honor — like Rep. Lauren Underwood — work to fulfill his vision for society.
docs.lead_paragraph: The closest Lauren Underwood ever came to being a baseball player was the night in 2007 when she was asked to throw out the ceremonial first pitch on Jackie Robinson Day at Comerica Park in Detroit. She practiced for days, tossing pitches from the mound of the baseball stadium of the University of Michigan, where she studied nursing.

headline.main: Jackie Robinson’s Legacy Stretches Beyond the Baseball Field

docs.abstract: The story of “Phantom of the Opera’s” meteoric rise and bittersweet closing.
docs.snippet: The story of “Phantom of the Opera’s” meteoric rise and bittersweet closing.
docs.lead_paragraph: ”The Phantom of the Opera,” the longest-running show in the history of Broadway, will close its doors on Sunday after more than three decades.

headline.main: Broadway’s Longest-Running Musical Turns Out the Lights

byline.original: By Michael Barbaro, Sydney Harper, Eric Krupke, Nina Feldman, Clare Toeniskoetter, Lexie Diao, Michael Benoist, Elisheba Ittoop, Dan Powell, Corey Schreppel, Marion Lozano, Diane Wong and Chris Wood

docs.abstract: To tackle climate change, we’ll need to plug in millions of cars, trucks, home heaters, stoves and factories.
docs.snippet: To tackle climate change, we’ll need to plug in millions of cars, trucks, home heaters, stoves and factories.
docs.lead_paragraph: To tackle climate change, we’ll need to plug in millions of cars, trucks, home heaters, stoves and factories.

headline.main: How Electrifying Everything Became a Key Climate Solution

byline.original: By Nadja Popovich and Brad Plumer

docs.abstract: How Times journalists tracked down the alleged leaker of top secret military intelligence.
docs.snippet: How Times journalists tracked down the alleged leaker of top secret military intelligence.
docs.lead_paragraph: Aric Toler untangles the web of teens, gamers and memes at the heart of the latest intelligence scandal.

headline.main: Inside the Hunt for the Discord Leaker, and Twitter Chaos Updates

byline.original: By Kevin Roose, Casey Newton, Davis Land, Rachel Cohn, Jen Poyant, Alyssa Moxley, Dan Powell, Elisheba Ittoop, Marion Lozano, Sophia Lanman and Rowan Niemisto

docs.lead_paragraph: Did you follow the news this week? Take our quiz to see how well you stack up with other Times readers.

docs.abstract: Not everyone evacuated when the Chernobyl nuclear plant melted down in 1986. The few who stayed lived through another calamity when Russian troops marched in.
docs.snippet: Not everyone evacuated when the Chernobyl nuclear plant melted down in 1986. The few who stayed lived through another calamity when Russian troops marched in.
docs.lead_paragraph: The world’s worst nuclear disaster, unfolding only a few miles away, did not force Halyna Voloshyna, 74, to abandon her home in Chernobyl in 1986.

headline.main: Ghosts Past and Present Cross Paths as War Comes to Nuclear Wasteland

byline.original: By Marc Santora and Emile Ducke

docs.abstract: As “The Phantom of the Opera” ends its record-breaking Broadway run on Sunday, its most devoted followers, who call themselves Phans, are mourning.
docs.snippet: As “The Phantom of the Opera” ends its record-breaking Broadway run on Sunday, its most devoted followers, who call themselves Phans, are mourning.
docs.lead_paragraph: “The Phantom of the Opera,” the longest running show in Broadway history, will give its final performance on Sunday, bringing its glittering chandelier crashing down on the stage of the Majestic Theater for the 13,981st and final time.
